name: The Smooth Shot Paddle Brush Blow-Dryer
about: What it is:A blow-dryer with the structure of a paddle brush to create a smooth blowout with added body in one quick, simple step..Hair Texture:Straight and Wavy.Hair Type:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Concerns:- Frizz.Key Benefits:- Creates smooth, straight blowouts.What Else You Need to Know:Great for detangling and creating a smooth, luminous blowout, this brush uses ionic technology to seal the cuticle for less frizz and tons of shine. Strategically placed vents allow for maximum airflow, while the broad, flat base ensures a faster drying time. The combination of long-length nylon and tufted bristles creates the perfect amount of tension for easy detangling and styling.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-After shampooing, thoroughly towel-dry hair to remove excess water. .-Brush out hair with a detangling brush or comb, then separate into large sections. .-Glide The Smooth Shot Paddle Brush Blow-Dryer through each section, working it slowly from roots to ends until hair is dry and smooth..-For added shape/bend, brush from beneath the section and angle brush in desired direction.

reviews.review_title: Be wary as it gets older
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Planned obselecense is a known thing to plan for; I'm not mad that it's starting to fail after a few years of daily use. But folks should know that each heating element is capped with a small plastic cap, and as the brush starts to break down, the caps will start to randomly fall off. What this amounts to is fingernail sized plastic pieces heated to 450 degrees randomly falling onto your skin. Be safe!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dark skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have long, thick 3c-4c multi-textured hair and bought this to replace my Revlon round blow-dry brush. My hair was about 75% dry when I started--adding in parting and spraying product before blow drying, I was done in 15 minutes which is about 5 minutes quicker than usual. Pretty easy to use and gets to the roots. My fellow 4c naturals--you will still need to flat iron or curl if you want a super sleek look unless you blow-dry from wet hair in very small sections, and even then you might still need a little extra. Remember to use as little product as possible for the best results (I always use Its A 10 for blowouts).

reviews.review_title: Works great on my long super curly hair!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First of all, I was NOT gifted this. I purchased it. I have very curly hair that is very fine. I used it for the first time last night and I loved it. My hair tends to get snagged in the round ones and it didn't get snagged at all with this brush. It didn't even take long to dry! It did not come out like it does when I take a flat iron to it, which was fine with me - although I probably could have taken a straighter to the coarse hair at the nape of my neck.  I used the low heat setting on the top of my head as that is where my hair is thinning so I didn't want to damage it. I used the high heat on the back which is where I have super coarse hair and it worked perfectly. I also like that it is light in weight. My arms didn't get tired at all. I'd definitely recommend this product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Recommendation - PASS I purchase this during Sephora's 20% off everything back in December.  The ads and pictures online looked convincing enough. Straightens hair in less time and adds shine.  The product is ok. The packaging and the product look cute. I found the handle somewhat bulky. The paddle brush dryer did shorten my styling time by 15-20%, but it did leave my hair dryer (even when I prepped my hair with a thermal spray). I still had to go back and finish with a straight iron. I did use the product again to double check my first impressions.  The second time I used the dryer, I was even less impressed.  For $130+, I expect more. I think if I used it regularly (a couple of times a week), this dryer could really damage my hair (and my hair doesn't damage easily). Returned it.  For reference, I have thick, course, and slightly wavy East Asian hair.

reviews.review_title: Smooth and sleek styles without frizz!

reviews.review_text: As someone who is consistently juggling personal and professional commitments, this tool saves me so much time because it helps me dry and style my hair all at once. It straightens my wavy hair effectively without forcing me to go over the same area multiple times.  Heated hair tools usually create a lot of frizz for me, but this one thankfully doesn’t add any frizz!  One tip I have is to use the tool on both sides of your hair for optimal results.  I brush the front facing side of hair to detangle and straighten my hair.  I brush the backside of hair- concentrating especially on the ends- to add bounce and body.
